categories: Road & Gravel > Drive > Crank and chain set
results.description: Still current and already a legend! The SRAM-RED® crank is available with decors that match the components of the eTap series. The crank is designed hollow throughout - up to the spider. The hidden chainring attachment takes advantage of carbon as a material, because it increases the stiffness and reduces the weight. Feature Available with chainrings: 53/39T, 52/36T or 50/34T. Feature Crank arm length: 165mm, 167.5mm, 170mm, 172.5mm or 175mm Chainline 45.5mm Bottom bracket type GXP Chainring mounting 110 BCD 130 BCD Diameter 24 mm Material Carbon Weight 565 g Scope of delivery Bottom bracket not included Road and Gravel groups Red 22 Red eTap Main group Drive parts Category Road bike Product subgroup Cranksets Activity Cycling Sport road bike triathlon Brand Sram Sales unit Piece

description: Still current and already a legend! The SRAM-RED® crank is available with decors that match the components

results.description: This adapter set allows SRAM calipers with standard or CPS Post Mount mount to attach to a frame or fork with Post Mount mount to be able to drive a larger brake disc. The adapters come with matching steel bolts and CPS washers. CPS - Caliper Positioning System allows the caliper to be precisely adjusted. categories: Workshop & Service > Brakes, Service > Disc brake pads
results.description: Use organic pads when: conditions are dry, you want good braking performance from the start / Advantages: better dosing, less noise, shorter run-in time, less weight due to aluminum carrier plate / Disadvantages: wears out faster. Compatible with: Code 2011+/ Guide RE Feature Brake pads must be replaced when the total thickness (backing plate and friction material) is less than 3 mm. MTB groups Code ≤2017 Code R Code RSC Guide RE Material pad - backing plate Organic - Aluminum Number of brake pistons 4-piston Scope of delivery 1 pair of brake pads incl. spring and bolt Weight 16 g Main product group Brakes Product subgroup Disc brake pads Activity Cycling Sport Downhill mountain bike Brand Sram Sales unit Pair NAV item commission group 820: Sram

categories: Workshop & Service > Brakes, Service > Disc brake pads
results.description: Use organic pads when: conditions are dry, you want good braking performance from the start / Advantages: better dosing, less noise, shorter run-in time / Disadvantages: wears out faster, more weight due to steel carrier plate. categories: Workshop & Service > Brakes, Service > Disc brake pads
results.description: Use sintered pads when: you ride downhill for a long time, conditions are wet, muddy, etc. / Advantages: better performance in wet conditions, less wear / Disadvantages: more noise, longer break-in time, not as much braking power at the beginning. Compatible with: Code 2011+ / Guide RE Feature Brake pads must be replaced when the total thickness (retaining plate and friction material) is less than 3 mm.
